üìú The Instructions

Expressions -

Read through the lesson - This lesson can be done together. Some of the children will need you to help them understand the concepts, play games with them or act as a scribe.

This is a Power Lesson. Power lessons are used to increase your students' level of math mastery. You can do this by submitting a video of your students doing the activity at the end of this lesson or a picture/scan of their written work.

This activity can be done at any time, but lunchtime is convenient because you would be eating anyway. In preparation your family needs to make food to use in your restaurant.

üéí 1. Gear Checklist

Gather these exact items:

Menu - You can make your own or fill out this one:

Money - pennies, dimes, nickels, quarters, $1 and for 2nd grade and up: $5,$10

üéØ 2. Your Objectives

Learn that money can be used to understand mathematical operations: addition/subtraction and multiplication/division.

I can write expressions with numbers and letters standing for numbers. (6.EE.2a)

I can figure out different answers to expressions when given specific values for the variable. (6.EE.2c)

I can solve real-world problems involving expression that arise from formulas. (6.EE.2c)

I can solve math problems including those with exponents, in the usual order (when no parentheses are there to give a particular order). (6.EE.2c)

üó∫Ô∏è 4. The Adventure (Activity)

üìú Verbatim Instructions:

Your kids can help you make a restaurant for lunch. The menu has different slots for the prices, because different age groups will need to work with different size numbers, i.e. a kindergarten could have a sandwich cost 5 cents where a fifth grader could have it cost $5.95. If you have children in fourth-sixth grade make sure that some prices include decimals. Specific instructions per grade are included below.

After you make the menu figure out how much it would cost if you bought A+B+C (The letters are on the side of the menu). What if you bought 2A+4B+D?

For some of the online activities you will need a free CK12 account.

To create a CK12 account:

Go to: https://www.ck12.org/student/

Click on the orange JOIN button in the upper right corner

Choose the option for email to sign up.

Enter your student's information. CK12 will ask students to input their teacher email. PLEASE ENTER THE TEACHER'S EMAIL: and the teacher will complete the registration process.

When registration is complete, the teacher will email you the username and password for your student account.

üí° üöÄ Mission Strategy: Step-by-Step

*(Use this guide to help you complete the instructions above)*

1. Create a Menu with 4 items. Give each a letter code (A, B, C, D) and a price.

2. Order 1: Calculate cost of A + B + C.

3. Order 2: Calculate 2A + 4B + D (That means 2 of item A, 4 of item B...)

4. Serve the food to your family and give them the bill!
